content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs a system, I previously encountered errors when attempting to generate an image for a scavenger hunt and check Twitter credentials. I also had trouble listing files and reading a file in a specific directory. However, I was able to execute a shell command to echo the Twitter API keys and access tokens. Recently, I received information from my computer that to obtain user access tokens for the Twitter API, one can use the 3-legged OAuth flow. This involves creating a request for a consumer application to obtain a request token, having the user authenticate and send the consumer application a request token, and converting the request token into a usable user access token. The obtained access tokens can be used to perform actions on behalf of the user, such as creating tweets.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "send_tweet", "args": {"tweet_text": "Check out these 20 creative scavenger hunt ideas for kids! #scavengerhunt #kidactivities"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command send_tweet returned: Error: 'Forbidden' object has no attribute 'reason'"}, {'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "execute_python_file", "args": {"filename": "/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/check_twitter_credentials.py"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command execute_python_file returned: Error: File '/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/check_twitter_credentials.py' does not exist."}]
